title: Request for Quotation - Ultrasonic Thickness Survey Services - Amine Treating Unit (ATU-100)
summary: This is a Request for Quotation (RFQ) document GLCP-RFQ-2024-089 issued by Great Lakes Chemical Processing (GLCP) on October 15, 2024, soliciting bids from qualified NDE contractors for ultrasonic thickness survey services on piping systems within the Amine Treating Unit (ATU-100) at their Hamilton, ON facility. The scope covers 18 piping lines with 150 total Condition Monitoring Locations (CMLs), with field work estimated at 4 days (November 4-7, 2024). Work must comply with API 570, API 574, ASME B31.3, and ASME Section V standards. Personnel must be ASNT SNT-TC-1A qualified UT Level II minimum. The document details technical requirements including 0.001" resolution digital UT gauges, deliverables schedule, safety requirements, and proposal submission requirements. It includes a detailed piping line list showing services (Rich Amine, Lean Amine, Sour Gas, Treated Gas, etc.), sizes (2"-8"), and materials (primarily A106 Gr.B carbon steel, some 316SS). Useful for answering questions about NDE contractor qualifications, inspection scope, schedule, compliance standards, and piping specifications.

sections.heading: 1. INTRODUCTION
sections.text: Great Lakes Chemical Processing (GLCP) is soliciting quotations from qualified Non-Destructive Examination (NDE) contractors to perform ultrasonic thickness (UT) survey services on piping systems within our Amine Treating Unit (ATU-100) at the Hamilton Plant facility. This survey is part of our ongoing mechanical integrity program in compliance with API 570 requirements.

sections.heading: 2. SCOPE OF WORK
sections.text:
2.1 General Requirements
The Contractor shall provide all personnel, equipment, and materials necessary to perform ultrasonic thickness measurements at designated Condition Monitoring Locations (CMLs) on the piping systems listed in Attachment A. The work shall be performed in accordance with the requirements specified herein and the applicable codes and standards.

2.2 Specific Tasks
• Perform ultrasonic thickness measurements at all designated CML locations
• Record thickness readings using digital data logging equipment
• Photograph each CML location and gauge display for critical readings
• Compare current readings to historical data (2019 survey) provided by GLCP
• Calculate corrosion rates based on historical trending
• Identify any readings below minimum required thickness (t-min)
• Prepare comprehensive inspection report with findings and recommendations
• Provide all raw data in electronic format (CSV/Excel)

sections.heading: 3. SCOPE SUMMARY
sections.text: Summary of scope including total piping lines, CML locations, estimated field days, and previous survey date.

sections.heading: 4. TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS
sections.text:
4.1 Applicable Codes and Standards
• API 570 - Piping Inspection Code
• API 574 - Inspection Practices for Piping System Components
• ASME B31.3 - Process Piping (for t-min calculations)
• ASME Section V, Article 5 - Ultrasonic Examination Methods
• GLCP-NDT-001 - Site-Specific NDE Requirements (Attachment B)

4.2 Equipment Requirements
All ultrasonic thickness gauges shall be digital instruments capable of 0.001" resolution with data logging capability. Calibration shall be verified daily using NIST-traceable step blocks. Current calibration certificates shall be provided prior to mobilization.

4.3 Personnel Qualifications
All inspection personnel shall be qualified to ASNT SNT-TC-1A or equivalent. Minimum qualification: UT Level II. Lead inspector shall have minimum 5 years experience in refinery/petrochemical piping inspection. All personnel shall complete GLCP site-specific safety orientation prior to work commencement.

sections.heading: 5. SCHEDULE
sections.text: Project schedule including milestones from RFQ issue through final report delivery.

sections.heading: 6. DELIVERABLES
sections.text: The Contractor shall provide the following deliverables: Draft Inspection Report, Final Inspection Report (PDF), Raw Data Files (CSV/Excel), Photographs (organized by CML), Calibration Certificates, Personnel Certifications, and Daily Field Reports with specified due dates.

sections.heading: 7. SAFETY REQUIREMENTS
sections.text: All Contractor personnel shall comply with GLCP safety requirements including but not limited to: completion of site-specific safety orientation, daily Job Safety Analysis (JSA) review, valid work permits for all activities, and adherence to all posted safety signage and procedures. Personal protective equipment requirements include: hard hat, safety glasses, steel-toed boots, FR clothing, and H2S monitor (provided by GLCP).

sections.heading: 8. PROPOSAL REQUIREMENTS
sections.text:
Proposals shall include the following:
• Company qualifications and relevant experience
• Proposed inspection team with certifications
• Equipment list with calibration status
• Detailed work plan and schedule
• Lump sum pricing with breakdown by task
• Rate schedule for potential additional work
• Sample inspection report from similar project
• Three (3) references from similar projects
• Proof of insurance ($2M general liability minimum)

sections.heading: 9. ATTACHMENTS

• Attachment A - Piping Line List and CML Summary
• Attachment B - GLCP-NDT-001 Site-Specific Requirements
• Attachment C - Previous Survey Data (2019)
